verses.text: Now Hiram king of Tyre sent his servants to Solomon, when he heard that they had anointed him king in place of his father, for Hiram had always loved David.
verses.comment: Solomon's ascension triggers diplomatic contact with Hiram, reflecting continuity from David.

verses.text: And Solomon sent word to Hiram, saying,
"You know that David my father could not build a house for the name of the LORD his God because of the wars which surrounded him, until the LORD put his enemies under his feet.
verses.comment: "House for the name" refers to the Temple; see also parallel passages in Chronicles.

verses.text: But now the LORD my God has given me rest on every side; there is neither adversary nor evil happening.
verses.comment: Rest from enemies is a fulfillment of Davidic promises.

verses.text: So I intend to build a house for the name of the LORD my God, as the LORD spoke to David my father, saying, "Your son, whom I will set on your throne in your place, he shall build the house for My name."
verses.comment: Restates God's promise about Solomon building the Temple.

verses.text: Now, therefore, command that cedars be cut for me from Lebanon; and my servants will join your servants, and I will give you wages for your servants as you say. For you know that there is no one among us who knows how to cut timber like the Sidonians.
verses.comment: Sidonians refers to people of Tyre/Sidon known for skilled timber work.

verses.text: As soon as Hiram heard the words of Solomon, he rejoiced greatly and said, "Blessed be the LORD this day, who has given David a wise son to be over this great people."
verses.comment: Hiram acknowledges YHWH and praises Solomon's wisdom.

verses.text: And Hiram sent word to Solomon, saying, "I have heard what you sent to me. I will do all you desire concerning the cedar and cypress timber.
verses.comment: Cypress timber included—often translated 'fir,' but refers to cypress.

verses.text: My servants will bring them down from Lebanon to the sea. I will make them into rafts to go by sea to the place you direct for me, and I will have them broken up there, so you can carry them away. You shall fulfill my wish by giving food for my household."
verses.comment: Rafts/barges are used. 'Food for household' implies agreement for grain and oil.

verses.text: So Hiram supplied Solomon with all the cedar and cypress timber he desired.
And Solomon gave Hiram twenty thousand cors of wheat as food for his household, and twenty cors of pure oil; so Solomon gave these to Hiram year by year.
verses.comment: 'Cors': approximately 6 bushels each; yearly provision for Hiram.

verses.text: And the LORD gave Solomon wisdom, as He had promised him. And there was peace between Hiram and Solomon, and they made a treaty together.
verses.comment: Solomon's wisdom is highlighted as divine fulfillment.

verses.text: King Solomon raised a forced labor out of all Israel, and the forced labor numbered thirty thousand men.
verses.comment: 'Forced labor' refers to corvée—conscription for public works.

verses.text: And he sent them to Lebanon, ten thousand a month in shifts; they were in Lebanon one month and home two months. Adoniram was in charge of the forced labor.
verses.comment: System details of the labor shift.

verses.text: Solomon had seventy thousand who carried burdens and eighty thousand who cut stone in the hills,
verses.comment: Numbers refer to different labor categories.

verses.text: besides Solomon's chief officers who were over the work, three thousand three hundred who directed the people who did the work.
verses.comment: Management structure described; 2 Chr. 2:18 counts differently.

verses.text: At the king’s command, they quarried great, costly stones to lay the foundation of the house with dressed stones.
verses.comment: Stones were cut and dressed for the Temple foundation.

verses.text: So Solomon’s builders and Hiram’s builders, along with the men of Gebal, cut and prepared the timber and stones for building the house.
verses.comment: Men of Gebal (Byblos) assisted; teamwork among Israelites, Tyrians, and Phoenicians.
